instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: so this board came in, with many corrosion all over the board, i have cleaned it, it intermittently have green light, sometimes not, when it does, board can turn on, and when stress testing, board suddenly turn off, with no green light ( dim ), I have ppbus 12.26, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3v, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v, no <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, so I thought this must be the smc, I have tried replacing smc 4 times but still doesnt turn on, tried changing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 1 times, still the same.. maybe is there any break in trace ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Check traces and resistors near SMC and opposite board side.
Pay atention to <RESISTOR>R4901</RESISTOR>/09 and <RESISTOR>R4902</RESISTOR>/98/99.
